ai-ud4.6:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ai-ud4.6:1.3_0: Now at that time Venerable Piṇḍola Bhāradvāja was sitting not far from the Buddha cross-legged, with his body straight. He was one of few wishes, content, secluded, aloof, energetic, dedicated to the higher mind. He was energetic, dedicated to fewness of wishes, content, secluded, aloof, and energetic.
ai-ud4.6:2.1_0: The Buddha saw him meditating there.
